intro: Cheiranthus strictus, commonly known as the upright wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, four-petaled, and usually pink or purple, blooming in early spring. The leaves are linear and hairy, and the plant is often found growing in rocky or disturbed soils.
